clues.text: This late, great rapper went by the alphanumeric version of his name when he joined forces with Dr. Dre on "California Love"
Later an actor & a Grammy winner, he teamed with Big Boi, with whom he went to high school in Atlanta
In 2004 Jay-Z had a hit with this many title "Problems" but hopefully, our clue ain't one
It would be a (disorganized) crime if you didn't know this group won an Oscar for their song "It's Hard Out Here For A Pimp"
Noted for neckware, he was in Playaz Circle before teaming with Drake to go platinum with "No Lie"
Now a synonym for photograph, it originally referred to the rapid firing of a gun without aiming
In 2021 this Canadian prime minister called a snap election
In kabuki theatre, a trap door used for dramatic entrances is called a suppon, which means this "snapping" reptile
In addition to the spice in the name, these cookies are made with molasses
The hinged "jaws" of this flower are pried open by bumblebees, its main pollinator

rounds.comments: (Ken: The correct responses within the text of each clue.)

clues.text: There's a certain braveness to this black bird
A little knowledge of this bird goes a long way
It lives in Europe & Asia, but not in Brooklyn
While riding my scooter, I spotted this old bird
We're amazed by this sea eagle's cleverness
Instituted in 1970, the legal classifications of these go from Schedule 1 to Schedule 5
Schenck v. U.S. addressed if sending antiwar pamphlets to drafted men in the midst of war was protected by this amendment
In legalese, CC can refer to cepi corpus ("I have taken the body") or this federal venue for appeals
Political advertising was at the heart of the 2010 case pitting this group against the Federal Election Commission
Evidence that exonerates someone from guilt is called this, which also starts with "ex"
The 1145 papal bull "Quantum Praedecessores" helped launch the second of these
In the 1890s the Socialist federation the Second International expelled believers in this no-government doctrine
The 1139 meeting known as the Second one of these councils invalidated marriages of priests, monks & nuns
In 1862 the second of these Virginia battles took place 13 months after the first & ended the same way, with a Confederate victory
The second one lasted from  218 to 201 B.C. & at the end, Rome was boss of the Mediterranean
Truffle hunter Nicolas Cage searches for his kidnapped foraging animal in this 2021 film with a 3-letter title
Dr. Robotnik returns to menace Earth in the 2022 sequel starring this furry blue video game character
Quentin Tarantino took home the Critics' Prize at the 1992 Toronto International Film Festival for this cops & robbers tale
In this 1988 comedy, Kevin Kline enjoys chips & the unfortunate title creature, much to Michael Palin's dismay
Daisy Edgar-Jones plays a rural southern woman suspected of murder in this 2022 film based on a bestseller
A state in Australia & an African waterfall both bear her name
Honoring Ms. Peron, Ciudad Evita is a small town in this country
Marie Byrd Land on this continent was named for the wife of Admiral Byrd
Located about 4 miles off the coast of Massachusetts, it's one of the few U.S. place names to have an apostrophe
This capital of South Australia was named for the wife of Britain's King William IV
On "Adventure Time", the Ice King was voiced by Tom Kenny, also the voice of this title guy since 1999... are ya ready, kids?!
After nearly dying in a car wreck in 1961, Mel Blanc, in a body cast at home, voiced this guy, Fred Flintstone's best pal
Businesses next to this title Fox eatery: A Site for Sore Thighs, A Small Price Toupee & Baby Got Back Problems Physical Therapy
A close-up of the clenched fist of this PBS character before he punched D.W. became a giant meme of anger expression
Going big on many levels, this title guy hung out with "The Masters of the Universe" & holding a sword, bellowed, "I have the power!"
Swedish chemist Carl Scheele proved that air was made of 2 gases: "fire air", oxygen, & "foul air", this element
While working with pitchblende in 1898, the Curies discovered polonium & this other element
This other name for mercury includes the name of a different element
In the 19th century busy chemist Jöns Jacob Berzelius  discovered silicon, thorium & this element, symbol Se
A small amount of this element is sometimes added to table salt to make up for human deficiencies of it
In this country you might ask "Where's the beef?" because there isn't any but there is dosa masala on a bun
In Hawaii you can start off your day with a platter of eggs, rice & this meat brand from a can
At McDonald's in Canada, you'll of course find this dish of French fries covered with gravy & cheese curds
At the Macca's, as they call it Down Under, this traditional savory spread has been offered with an English muffin
Breakfast in Venezuela includes cheese these, Spanish-named turnovers

clues.text: Radius
Moose

Schema
Not even bearded yet, in 1953 he led a failed revolt by storming Cuba's Moncada Barracks
In 1680 this New Mexico capital was taken in the anti-Catholic Pueblo Revolt led by Popé; you know he insisted on that accented E
The -ists named for this month failed to topple the czar in 1825 but inspired the name of a 21st century band
Much of Rome's grain came from this large island 300 miles away, so it was a big deal when its slaves revolted in the Servile Wars
Kossuth Square in Budapest is named for the man who in the 1840s led a revolt against the rule of Hungary by this Austrian family

rounds.text: In bold letters, it was the 2-word historic N.Y. Times headline for August 9, 1974, followed by "He urges a time of 'healing"'
